meanings.definition: A person who is very skilled or successful at a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: The young whizz impressed everyone with his piano skills.
meanings.sent2: The coding whizz fixed the computer issue in no time.
meanings.sent3: The baking whizz made a cake that was out of this world.
meanings.sent4: She was a marketing whizz, always coming up with brilliant ideas.
meanings.sent5: The gardening whizz transformed the backyard into a beautiful oasis.

meanings.definition: To move quickly through the air with a whistling or whooshing sound.
meanings.sent1: The paper airplane whizzed past the students in class.
meanings.sent2: The cars whizzed by on the highway, leaving a trail of dust.
meanings.sent3: The bird whizzed through the sky, chasing its prey.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to whizz by as they enjoyed their day at the park.
meanings.sent5: The wind whizzed through the trees, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.sent1: The puppy needed to whizz after drinking so much water.
meanings.sent2: He hurried to the restroom to whizz before the movie started.
meanings.sent3: The toddler announced loudly that he needed to whizz at the park.
meanings.sent4: She regretted not stopping to whizz before the long road trip.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rain made her feel like she needed to whizz.
